wines.description: This rare white Tempranillo from Bodegas Paco Garcia showcases an unusual expression of Spain's most famous red grape. White Tempranillo offers fresh, aromatic character with good acidity and moderate body. An intriguing Spanish white wine that demonstrates innovative winemaking.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents fresh aromas of white flowers, citrus, and green apple, with subtle herbal notes and a touch of minerality. Hints of stone fruit including peach and apricot add complexity, while a delicate floral character provides elegance. The aromatic profile is clean and vibrant.
tastingNotes.palate: Medium-bodied with crisp acidity and clean fruit flavors. Notes of citrus, apple, and stone fruit dominate, complemented by herbal undertones and mineral notes. The wine displays good balance with refreshing acidity and subtle depth. Mid-palate shows layers of fruit and herb flavors.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and moderately long with persistent citrus and floral notes. Crisp acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for food.

wineDetails.ageability: Best enjoyed within 3-5 years; drink now through 2024

wines.productName: Tarara Late Harvest Petit Manseng 2010 (375 ml)
wines.description: This late harvest Petit Manseng from Tarara Winery showcases Virginia's ability to produce world-class dessert wines. The 2010 vintage has developed considerable complexity with age. A luscious, well-balanced dessert wine with remarkable aging potential.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose reveals intense aromas of apricot, honey, and candied citrus peel, with notes of tropical fruits including pineapple and mango. Complex secondary aromas of orange marmalade, ginger, and baking spices emerge. Hints of caramel and butterscotch from bottle age add richness.
tastingNotes.palate: Full-bodied with luscious sweetness balanced by vibrant acidity. Flavors of dried apricot, honey, and tropical fruits dominate, complemented by notes of candied ginger, orange zest, and crème brûlée. The wine displays excellent balance despite the sweetness, with refreshing acidity providing lift. Mid-palate complexity includes flavors of marmalade and spice.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is very long and persistent with lingering notes of honey, apricot, and spice. Balanced sweetness and acidity create a harmonious, mouthwatering conclusion.

wineDetails.style: Late harvest dessert wine with aging complexity
wineDetails.ageability: Excellent aging potential; drink now through 2035

wines.description: This Montepulciano from Colle Corviano showcases the Abruzzo variety's characteristic dark fruit and soft tannins. The 2023 vintage is fresh and youthful, offering immediate drinking pleasure. An approachable Italian red wine with food-friendly character.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents aromas of dark cherry, plum, and blackberry, with notes of violet, dried herbs, and a touch of earth. Subtle hints of spice and tobacco add complexity. The aromatic profile is fruit-forward and inviting.
tastingNotes.palate: Medium to full-bodied with soft, rounded tannins and moderate acidity. Flavors of dark cherry, plum, and berry fruits dominate, complemented by notes of earth, herbs, and subtle spice. The wine displays good concentration with smooth texture. Mid-palate shows depth with layers of fruit and savory notes.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is moderately long with persistent dark fruit and earthy notes. Soft tannins and balanced structure create an easy-drinking conclusion.

wineDetails.ageability: Best within 3-5 years; drink now through 2028

wines.description: This Argentine Malbec from Mendoza showcases the variety's signature dark fruit and velvety texture. The wine represents excellent value from Argentina's premier wine region. A classic expression of Mendoza Malbec with ripe fruit and smooth character.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose reveals aromas of blackberry, plum, and dark cherry, with notes of violet, mocha, and vanilla. Hints of tobacco and leather add complexity, while subtle spice notes emerge. The aromatic profile is rich and inviting.
tastingNotes.palate: Full-bodied with velvety tannins and moderate acidity. Flavors of ripe dark berries dominate, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet oak. The wine displays classic Malbec richness with smooth texture and good depth. Mid-palate shows layers of fruit, spice, and earth.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit and chocolate notes. Smooth tannins and balanced structure create a generous conclusion.

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2029; optimal drinking window

wines.description: This Spanish Crianza from Rippa Dorii showcases traditional oak aging with modern winemaking. The wine offers classic Spanish character with balance and structure. A well-crafted expression of Spanish red wine with food-friendly appeal.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents aromas of red cherry, plum, and strawberry, with notes of vanilla, toast, and cedar from oak aging. Hints of leather, tobacco, and dried herbs add complexity. The aromatic profile shows traditional Crianza character.
tastingNotes.palate: Medium to full-bodied with soft, integrated tannins and balanced acidity. Flavors of red fruit are complemented by oak-derived notes of vanilla, spice, and toast. The wine displays good concentration with smooth texture. Mid-palate shows depth with layers of fruit and savory notes.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is moderately long with persistent fruit and oak notes. Soft tannins and balanced structure create a harmonious conclusion.

wineDetails.style: Traditional Spanish Crianza with oak aging

wines.description: This aged Rioja Reserva from Bodegas Ontañón showcases traditional extended aging with considerable bottle development. The 2010 vintage has evolved beautifully, displaying tertiary complexity. A mature, elegant Rioja ready for immediate enjoyment.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose reveals complex aromas of dried cherry, leather, and tobacco, with notes of cedar, vanilla, and earth. Tertiary aromas of forest floor, mushroom, and truffle emerge from extended aging. Hints of balsamic and spice add depth. The aromatic profile shows beautiful evolution.
tastingNotes.palate: Medium-bodied with silky, resolved tannins and balanced acidity. Flavors of dried red fruit are complemented by savory notes of leather, tobacco, earth, and cedar. The wine displays excellent maturity with complex, layered flavors. Mid-palate shows depth with tertiary characteristics dominating.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and elegant with persistent savory notes and gentle tannins. The wine's maturity creates a harmonious, sophisticated conclusion.

servingInfo.decanting: Gentle decanting recommended to remove sediment

wineDetails.grapeVariety: Tempranillo with possible Garnacha and Graciano
wineDetails.style: Reserva with extended aging (minimum 3 years, 1 in oak)
wineDetails.ageability: At peak maturity; drink now through 2028

wines.description: This Virginia Riesling from Dogwood & Thistle showcases the Shenandoah Valley's potential for aromatic white wines. The 2023 vintage is fresh and vibrant with excellent balance. A refined expression of Virginia terroir with food-friendly character.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents classic Riesling aromatics of lime, green apple, and white flowers, with notes of citrus blossom and honey. Subtle mineral notes and a hint of petrol add complexity. The aromatic profile is fresh and inviting.
tastingNotes.palate: Light to medium-bodied with electric acidity and bright fruit flavors. Notes of lime, apple, and stone fruit dominate, with supporting flavors of honey and citrus. The wine displays excellent balance between sweetness and acidity. Mid-palate shows good depth with mineral notes.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent citrus and mineral notes. Crisp acidity creates a mouthwatering conclusion.

wineDetails.style: Virginia Riesling with balance and freshness
wineDetails.ageability: Best within 3-5 years; drink now through 2028

wines.description: This Sancerre Rosé from Domaine Bizet showcases Pinot Noir in a delicate pink expression from Loire's limestone soils. The wine offers crisp acidity and refined fruit character. An elegant French rosé with minerality and freshness.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose reveals delicate aromas of strawberry, raspberry, and red currant, with notes of citrus and white flowers. Subtle mineral notes of chalk and flint add complexity. The aromatic profile is fresh and refined.
tastingNotes.palate: Light to medium-bodied with crisp acidity and clean fruit flavors. Flavors of red berries and citrus dominate, complemented by distinct minerality. The wine displays excellent tension between fruit and acidity. Mid-palate shows subtle depth with saline notes.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent berry and mineral notes. Crisp acidity leaves the palate cleansed.

wineDetails.ageability: Best enjoyed young; drink within 1-2 years

wines.description: This white Bordeaux from the Entre-Deux-Mers region showcases Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon in a fresh, aromatic style. The wine offers excellent value from this historic Bordeaux appellation. A crisp, food-friendly white wine with regional character.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents aromas of citrus, green apple, and white flowers, with notes of grapefruit and fresh herbs. Subtle mineral notes add complexity. The aromatic profile is clean and vibrant.
tastingNotes.palate: Medium-bodied with crisp acidity and clean fruit flavors. Notes of citrus, apple, and stone fruit dominate, with supporting herbal and mineral notes. The wine displays good balance and refreshing character. Mid-palate shows subtle depth.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is clean and moderately long with persistent citrus notes. Crisp acidity creates a refreshing conclusion.

wineDetails.ageability: Best within 2-3 years; drink now through 2026

wines.description: This approachable rosé wine offers fresh fruit flavors and easy-drinking character. The wine is designed for casual enjoyment with broad appeal. A versatile rosé perfect for warm weather and relaxed occasions.

tastingNotes.aroma: The nose presents fresh aromas of strawberry, watermelon, and citrus. Light floral notes add subtle complexity. The aromatic profile is straightforward and fruit-driven.
tastingNotes.palate: Light-bodied with crisp acidity and clean fruit flavors. Flavors of red berries and citrus dominate with a refreshing, uncomplicated character. The wine displays good balance and easy drinkability.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is short and clean with lingering berry notes. Refreshing acidity provides balance.

wineDetails.ageability: Best enjoyed immediately; drink within 1 year
